description: A combustion engine.  Burns fuel from a tank in the vehicle.
A combustion engine for use on aircraft.  Burns gasoline or avgas fuel from a tank in the vehicle.
A combustion engine.  Burns diesel fuel from a tank in the vehicle.  Can also burn biodiesel or kerosene, though somewhat less efficiently.
A combustion engine.  Burns gasoline fuel from a tank in the vehicle.

An advanced combustion engine.  Burns gasoline or diesel or aviation fuel from a tank in the vehicle.  Can also burn kerosene, though somewhat less efficiently.  Better power-to-weight ratio than a traditional engine, but consumes more fuel.
A closed cycle, external combustion steam engine.  Burns coal or charcoal from a bunker in the vehicle to produce steam.

name: inline 6-cylinder diesel engine
description: An inline 6-cylinder diesel engine.  Somewhat more powerful but much larger than a V6, you might see an engine like this in a road roller or excavator.

name: four-cylinder diesel engine
description: A four-cylinder diesel engine, commonly found in small passenger cars and light trucks.

name: powerful 6-cylinder diesel engine
description: A powerful 6-cylinder diesel engine, typical of a bus, RV, large van, or armored personnel carrier.

name: large 8-cylinder diesel engine
description: A large 8-cylinder diesel engine, powerful enough for a semi truck, armored car, or Humvee.

name: small 1-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A small 1-cylinder gasoline engine delivering around 10 horsepower, enough for a scooter or motorized bicycle.

name: hefty 1-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A hefty 1-cylinder gasoline engine of about 55 horsepower, normally found in a motocross or dirt bike.

name: small 1-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A small 1-cylinder gasoline engine with only a few horsepower, suitable for a push lawn mower.

name: light aero engine
description: an engine used to power an aircraft

name: four-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A four-cylinder gasoline engine, commonly found in small passenger cars and light trucks.

name: massive 12-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A massive 12-cylinder gasoline engine, with the kind of power you might need in a sports car.

name: massive 12-cylinder diesel engine
description: A massive 12-cylinder diesel engine, typical of a heavy cargo truck.

name: powerful 6-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A powerful 6-cylinder gasoline engine strong enough for a pickup truck, SUV, or full-size van.

name: heavy-duty 8-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A heavy-duty 8-cylinder gasoline engine, like you might find in a fire truck, ambulance, or tow truck.

name: 2-cylinder gasoline engine
description: A 2-cylinder gasoline engine appropriate for a motorcycle or quad bike.

name: makeshift steam engine
description: a makeshift steam engine that performs mechanical work using steam as its working fluid

name: small steam engine
description: a small steam engine that performs mechanical work using steam as its working fluid

name: a medium steam engine
description: a medium steam engine that performs mechanical work using steam as its working fluid

name: small gas turbine engine
description: A small but powerful gas turbine engine, suitable for powering a small one or two-seat helicopter.

name: heavy-duty gas turbine engine
description: A heavy-duty gas turbine engine, like those typically found in a Medevac, Apache, or Blackhawk helicopter.

name: huge gas turbine engine
description: A huge gas turbine engine, used to lift large military helicopters such as the V-22 Osprey.
